say.phrase: The ocean is a body of saline water that covers two thirds of the earth's surface.

picture.source: By Tiago Fioreze (Own work) [CC BY-SA 3.0 (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0) or GFDL (http://www.gnu.org/copyleft/fdl.html)], via Wikimedia Commons

say.phrase: The Arctic Ocean is the smallest and shallowest of the world's five major oceans.

picture.source: By CIA - CIA World Factbook (https://www.cia.gov/library/publications/the-world-factbook/geos/xq.html), Public Domain, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=7627324

say.phrase: The Atlantic Ocean is the second largest of the world's oceans with a total area of about 41,100,000 square miles. It covers approximately 20 percent of the Earth's surface and about 29 percent of its water surface area.

picture.source: By Catrin (Own work, Using GMT) [GFDL (http://www.gnu.org/copyleft/fdl.html) or CC BY-SA 3.0 (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0)], via Wikimedia Commons

say.phrase: The Indian Ocean is the third largest of the world's oceanic divisions, covering 27,240,000 sq miles, approximately 20% of the water on the Earth's surface.

picture.source: By United States Central Intelligence Agency - The World Factbook, Public Domain, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=89448

say.phrase: The Pacific Ocean is the largest and deepest of Earth's oceanic divisions.

picture.source: By CIA World Factbook - CIA World Factbook, Public Domain, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=7627409

say.phrase: The Southern Ocean, also known as the Antarctic Ocean[1] or the Austral Ocean,[2][note 4] comprises the southernmost waters of the World Ocean, generally taken to be south of 60° S latitude and encircling Antarctica.

picture.source: By Connormah - Own work by uploader, based on File:Location Antarctica.svg, CC BY-SA 3.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=8029654

say.phrase: Fish have backbones, gills and fins, and are cold blooded.

picture.source: By Diliff, CC BY 2.5, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=823649

say.phrase: Jellyfish or jellies[1] are softbodied, free-swimming aquatic animals with a gelatinous umbrella-shaped bell and trailing tentacles.

picture.source: By Dan90266 - http://www.flickr.com/photos/dan90266/37269957/, CC BY-SA 2.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=527474

say.phrase: Whales are a widely distributed and diverse group of fully aquatic placental marine mammals.

picture.source: By Michaël CATANZARITI - by Michaël CATANZARITI, CC BY-SA 3.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=396382

say.phrase: Dolphins are a widely distributed and diverse group of aquatic mammals.

picture.source: By NASAs - http://mediaarchive.ksc.nasa.gov/detail.cfm?mediaid=21807, Public Domain, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=112006

say.phrase: The octopus is a soft-bodied, eight-armed mollusc.

picture.source: By albert kok - ma photo, CC BY-SA 3.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=2795257

say.phrase: Squid are cephalopods of the order Teuthida, which comprises around 304 species.

picture.source: By © Hans Hillewaert, CC BY-SA 4.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=385705

say.phrase: Lobsters have long bodies with muscular tails, and live in crevices or burrows on the sea floor.

picture.source: By Bart Braun - Own work, Public Domain, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=4425087

say.phrase: Shrimp are swimming crustaceans with long narrow muscular abdomens and long antennae.

picture.source: By Etrusko25 - Own work, Public Domain, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=8045392

say.phrase: Krill are small crustaceans of the order Euphausiacea, and are found in all the world's oceans.

picture.source: By Øystein Paulsen - MAR-ECO, CC BY-SA 3.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=225249

say.phrase: Plankton are the diverse collection of organisms that live in large bodies of water and are unable to swim against a current. They provide a crucial source of food to many large aquatic organisms, such as fish and whales.

picture.source: By Kils at the German language Wikipedia, CC BY-SA 3.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=4852729

say.phrase: Starfish are marine invertebrates. They typically have a central disc and five arms, though some species have a larger number of arms.

picture.source: By Nhobgood Nick Hobgood - Own work, CC BY-SA 3.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=6279893

say.phrase: Sand is a naturally occurring granular material composed of finely divided rock and mineral particles. It is defined by size, being finer than gravel and coarser than silt.

picture.source: By Siim Sepp - Own work, CC BY-SA 3.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=17276362

say.phrase: Water is a transparent and nearly colorless chemical substance that is the main constituent of Earth's streams, lakes, and oceans, and the fluids of most living organisms.

picture.source: By Kim Hansen - Own work (Own photo), CC BY-SA 3.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=2847421

say.phrase: A beach is a landform alongside a body of water which consists of loose particles.

picture.source: By Adrian Pingstone (Arpingstone) - Own work, Public Domain, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=7303133
